title: Ticket #4304: Collector should publish a statistic for the rate of updates handled.
description: Collector should publish a statistic showing the rate at which it is handling updates.
remarks:
2014-Apr-11 09:22:40 by bbockelm:
Hi TJ,

Can you include a Ganglia metric too?

Brian

2014-Jun-23 14:18:48 by johnkn:
Current code isn't ready for use by those who shower more than yearly. The attribute names are weird, and none of the values are published by default.

if you configure 

   COLLECTOR.STATISTICS_TO_PUBLISH = DC:1

you get these, as well as about 20 more stats about the state of daemon core. 

   DCCollector_UpdatesReceived = 19
   DCCollector_UpdatesReceivedPerSecond_4m = 0.01619333308915539
   DCCommands = 75
   DCCommandsPerSecond_4m = 0.05768514585630172

But these stats should be published without the DC prefix, and should be published by default in the collector ad. Ideally, the freshest value should be written into the collector ad each time it is queried.
